about.title: About Our Centre
about.content: Centrul de Cultură, Limbă și Tradiție Românească is dedicated to preserving and promoting Romanian language, culture, and traditions for children in the Romanian community of Northamptonshire. We provide quality education in a friendly and inclusive environment.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content1: Centrul de Cultură, Limbă și Tradiție Românească in Wellingborough is dedicated to preserving and promoting Romanian language, culture, and traditions for children in the Romanian community.
mission.content2: Our mission is to provide quality education in Romanian language, in a friendly and inclusive environment where children can learn and grow together. We cultivate identity and build the future.

teacher.title: Our Teacher
teacher.name: Laura Nan
teacher.bio1: Laura Nan is the founder and teacher of our cultural centre. With extensive teaching experience gained in Romania, Laura dedicates her time and energy to providing Romanian children in the UK with authentic education in Romanian language and culture.
teacher.bio2: For the past two years, Laura has been teaching at a Romanian school in Northampton, where she strengthened her passion for maintaining the cultural identity of children in the diaspora.
teacher.bio3: Laura brings not only solid pedagogical knowledge but also a deep love for the Romanian community in the United Kingdom.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.orgName: Centrul de Cultură, Limbă și Tradiție Românească CIC
privacy.address: Goldsmith Road, Wellingborough, NN8 3RU, United Kingdom
privacy.section1Content: This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, store, and use personal information from parents, children, staff, and volunteers who take part in our activities.
privacy.section2Content: We may collect: parent and child names, contact details and emergency contacts; attendance records; photographs or videos (only with written consent); and payment details for trimestrial contributions.
privacy.section3Content: We use personal data to organise classes and cultural events; communicate with parents and volunteers; keep attendance and safeguarding records; manage payments and receipts; and promote our activities (only with consent for photos).
privacy.section4Content: We process personal data under the UK GDPR and the Data Protection Act 2018. We rely on legitimate interest to run our educational activities and on explicit consent for photography and promotional use.
privacy.section5Content: Data is stored securely on password-protected devices or in locked files. We do not share personal data with third parties except when required by law or to protect vital interests.
privacy.section6Content: We retain personal data only as long as necessary for educational, financial, or legal purposes, after which it is securely deleted or anonymised.
privacy.section7Content: You may request access, correction, deletion, or restriction of your personal data.
privacy.section8Content: Questions about this policy or data access requests can be sent to lauranan@yahoo.com or in writing to the address above.

terms.title: Terms & Conditions
terms.orgName: Centrul de Cultură, Limbă și Tradiție Românească CIC
terms.address: Goldsmith Road, Wellingborough, NN8 3RU, United Kingdom
terms.section1Content: Registration is required before attending classes. Parents must provide accurate contact details and inform the centre of any changes.
terms.section2Content: Regular attendance helps children benefit fully from lessons. Please notify us in advance if your child cannot attend.
terms.section3Content: Families may choose to pay either a trimestrial contribution or a pay-as-you-go option. All payments support the running costs of the Centre. Fees are non-refundable once a class has started, except where the Centre cancels a full session or term.
terms.section4Content: We expect respectful behaviour from children, parents, and volunteers. Disruptive or unsafe conduct may lead to temporary or permanent exclusion to protect others.
terms.section5Content: We are committed to maintaining a safe environment. Staff and volunteers follow safeguarding procedures and report concerns immediately. Parents must provide accurate emergency contacts and relevant medical information.
terms.section6Content: Photos and videos may be taken for promotional use only with written parental consent. Consent can be withdrawn at any time by email.
terms.section7Content: Personal data is managed according to our Privacy Policy, compliant with the UK GDPR.
terms.section8Content: Official updates will be sent via email, WhatsApp, or printed notices. Parents are encouraged to keep contact details up to date.
terms.section9Content: We take reasonable care to ensure the safety of children. The centre cannot accept responsibility for loss of personal property or for accidents arising from failure to follow staff instructions.
terms.section10Content: We may update these Terms & Conditions to reflect legal or operational changes. The latest version will be available on request.

health.title: Health & Safety Policy
health.orgName: Centrul de Cultură, Limbă și Tradiție Românească CIC
health.address: Goldsmith Road, Wellingborough, NN8 3RU, United Kingdom
health.section1Content: The Centre is committed to ensuring the health, safety, and welfare of all children, staff, volunteers, and visitors who participate in our activities.
health.section2Content: The Health & Safety Officer for the Centre is Laura Nan. She is responsible for overseeing health and safety measures.
health.section3Content: This policy complies with the Health and Safety at Work Act 1974 and relevant UK guidance for community and educational settings.
health.section4Content: Risk assessments will be carried out for all activities, venues, and equipment. Identified risks will be recorded and managed appropriately.
health.section5Content: All facilities and equipment must be safe, well-maintained, and suitable for children. Any hazard should be reported immediately.
health.section6Content: A first aid kit will be available during all classes. At least one trained adult will be present. Parents must provide relevant medical information.
health.section7Content: Fire exits must be clearly marked. Staff and volunteers must guide children to safety following evacuation procedures.
health.section8Content: Children must be supervised at all times by authorised staff or volunteers.
health.section9Content: All accidents must be recorded in an accident log and reported to the Health & Safety Officer.
health.section10Content: All areas will be kept clean and hygienic. Handwashing facilities and cleaning supplies will be available.
health.section11Content: This policy will be reviewed annually. Next review: January 2027.

equality.title: Equality, Diversity & Inclusion Policy
equality.orgName: Centrul de Cultură, Limbă și Tradiție Românească CIC
equality.address: Goldsmith Road, Wellingborough, NN8 3RU, United Kingdom
equality.section1Content: The Centre is committed to promoting equality, celebrating diversity, and ensuring inclusion across all its activities.
equality.section2Content: This policy aligns with the Equality Act 2010 and other relevant UK legislation.
equality.section3Content: We believe that equality and inclusion enrich our community. Our approach is based on respect, fairness, empathy, and collaboration.
equality.section4Content: The Centre's leadership, led by Laura Nan, is responsible for implementing this policy.
equality.section5Content: All participants will have equal access to our classes and events regardless of background.
equality.section6Content: Any form of bullying, exclusion, or discriminatory behaviour will not be tolerated.
equality.section7Content: Our lessons will reflect diversity and promote understanding of different cultures and beliefs.
equality.section8Content: We aim to make our activities accessible to everyone with reasonable adjustments where needed.
equality.section9Content: This policy will be reviewed annually. Feedback is always welcome.

volunteer.title: Volunteer Code of Conduct
volunteer.orgName: Centrul de Cultură, Limbă și Tradiție Românească CIC
volunteer.address: Goldsmith Road, Wellingborough, NN8 3RU, United Kingdom
volunteer.section1Content: This Code outlines expected standards of behaviour for all volunteers supporting the Centre's activities.
volunteer.section2Content: Volunteers are expected to act with respect, honesty, and kindness at all times.
volunteer.section3Content: Volunteers must arrive on time, follow instructions, and maintain a positive example for children.
volunteer.section4Content: All volunteers must prioritise the welfare and safety of children. Any concern must be reported immediately to Laura Nan.
volunteer.section5Content: Volunteers must communicate respectfully. Private information must not be disclosed to others.
volunteer.section6Content: Volunteers must follow all health and safety instructions. Any hazards must be reported to Laura Nan.
volunteer.section7Content: Volunteers should maintain clear boundaries with children and families.
volunteer.section8Content: If a volunteer witnesses behaviour that breaches this Code, they must report it immediately.
volunteer.section9Content: Failure to follow this Code may result in a warning or removal from volunteering duties.
